Reviews.Title: “Walking in Memphis”
Reviews.Author: bagator1
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel several times traveling east and west for various reasons. The hotel staff are wonderful! The property is a little older, but management has done well to maintain it, and the services and facilities are very good. It provides an excellent value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is Makes Customer Service a Priority”
Reviews.Author: FLJ021251
Reviews.Content: I just spent one night at this Marriott. The location is great with many restaurants nearby. The hotel seems to cater to the business community and in fact I was conducting a conference at the hotel is everything went smoothly. The front desk staff are very helpful. I do want to say a special thankyou to the front desk manager. My cell phone had fallen between the seats of my can and since it was dark I could not locate it. The front desk manager used this cell phone to call my cell phone several times while I loated it fromt he ringing. Thank you!! I received a room on the club lounge and again found the staff to be friendly and helpful. The sleeping room was fairly standard, with the bedding showing some wear. Even though I was near the ice machine, the room are quiet. I did find it odd that the room did not have a flat screen TV, but rather the old model. There are many elevators and getting to the higher floors is quick and easy. The food in the club is pretty standard for a Marriott. The intent is not to make this a meal. It does seem lately that that Marriott is cutting back in their food quality. Getting to the hotel is easy, just off the interstate. When I am back in Memphis I will probably stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Average Marriott Experience”
Reviews.Author: red_x_oktober
Reviews.Content: Recently had a one night stay for a business trip. The hotel was conveniently located fairly close to the airport and near to the area where I was working. They appeared to have an airport shuttle in operation, although I did not use it. I'm not sure if this comes complimentary, or if there's a fee involved. The lobby was clean and elegant, but seemed scaled down in size from other Marriott hotels I've visited. Check in was prompt and my room was clean and perfunctory. It was laid out in the same style you are used to at the Marriott.. Bathroom was spacious and off the front door of the entrance. Two double beds and a TV cabinet... And a small desk workspace and an armchair. I had the same problem with this room that I had at my last stay at another Marriott hotel. There were no visible electric outlets near the beds for charging up my phone overnight. One of the other members of our party experienced a problem when she got to her room. The room appeared to be guest-ready at a glance, but upon further inspection, she found a bar of soap out in the bathroom, some trash on the floor, and a used coffee cup in the trash can. I'm not sure what exactly happened but they switched her room promptly. Internet access is not free in this hotel -- neither in the guest rooms nor the lobby. Paid $9.95 for access until noon the next day but other packages were available. I can't blame this hotel for charging for Internet access; however, I am really looking forward to the day when hotels just include this in your nightly rate. A couple of the members of our party were shocked that this was extra and several of us weren't surprised at all. I'm not sure what hotel chains they are accustomed to staying in, but I find it more of a surprise when you aren't charged extra. I'm used to it, but it is kind of like charging you extra for towels at this point. Based on the area where I was working during my stay, this area didn't strike me as the best neighborhood in town. If you don't have a rental car or aren't prepared to pay for a cab, there is nowhere to wander to for a dinner off of the property.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing out of the ordinary..”
Reviews.Author: ez369
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed on a Sunday night using a reward night so the room cost was complimentary for me. Upon checking in, i was immediately recognized as being an elite member a few times and my room requests were confirmed and was placed in a 9th floor room. Service at the front desk was very friendly and cordial. As others have alluded in previous reviews, the location of the hotel may not be the greatest. Its right off the freeway and pretty close to a residential area, and I'll agree that it doesn't appear to be in the best of neighborhoods.. But then again, usually neighborhoods near airports aren't the best. It's maybe 5 minutes from the airport, so that was a plus. In hindsight, maybe I should have booked something in downtown as I did enjoy wandering around downtown and Beale street more. Downtown and Beale St does have it's share of panhandlers though.. I had no problems with the room I was in and it was clean. The bed was comfortable and I had requested extra pillows. As reviewers have noted, you can tell its an aging property and it's probably time for a refresh of the rooms and hallways. The tube tv has got to go! I didn't dine at the property or order room service however I had a few drinks at the hotel bar and service was fine. It appeared the bar closed around midnight on a Sun night. All in all, the overall hotel experience was average, although everything was perfectly fine with the service.

Reviews.Title: “Generally OK I suppose”
Reviews.Author: MDH_CoClare
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel several times in the past few years, and overall it's fair to say that it's 'OK'. Any of the bedrooms I stayed in are pretty tired and shabby at this stage... but overall they are clean and the beds are comfortable. Staff are generally helpful and very friendly and welcoming. The food in the bar or restaurant isn't dependable (not even the simple stuff) and their draft beer taps rarely work properly (how difficult can it be to fix this?). Breakfast is OK if a little expensive, but serving stale lettuce and inedible croutons in a Caesar salad demonstrates a basic lack of effort in my opinion. Not investing in decorating or new TVs I can probably understand, but there can be no such excuse when it comes to food.

Reviews.Title: “So-so”
Reviews.Author: larryderm
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel twice within a ten day period. The first time was nice, but the second required a room change due to a broken toilet. Also, that room could have used more cleaning, as exemplified by a dirty telephone. It is also a pity that there is a charge for internet.

Reviews.Title: “So so, nothing to write home about”
Reviews.Author: TammyJane
Reviews.Content: For a Marriott, this one was a little tired, showing its age. Not in the best of locations either. Certainly not an area you would want to walk around in by any means. I guess that is why it is surrounding by a big FENCE! If your shuttling here from the airport without a car, you will definitely be eating in. Restaurant was OK. Would expect to pay less in this area for sure. Was not happy about no free wi-fi anywhere. Not even in the lobby area or concierge lounge. Really??!! Get with it Marriott Memphis!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, but, there is a wrought iron gate all the way around it”
Reviews.Author: Bigger32
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel to be just fine. When checking in, I asked the front desk personnel why the hotel had a "security" gate all the way around the property. The young lady behind the desk responded: "don't all hotels have gates like that?". The location reminded me of an area that was probably meant to be a bustling office park, but, never actually jumped off. It is kind of an oasis nearly off by itself, and surrounded otherwise by "out of business" buildings on the main road, and other non-descript retail outlets on Perkins Blvd. My room on the 8th floor was rather large and clean. Bathrooms had plenty of clean, fresh smelling towels and was clean. Bed was clean and very comfortable. Room was very quiet--I never heard anyone else. Since I'm a frequent traveller, I was given access to the Conceirge level. I made a drink for myself while in the lounge, but, was abruptly confronted by the attendant to fill out an honor bar form--as if I was stealing a drink!!! They should train attendants to be careful about things like that--I could have been very insulted by her actions. Otherwise, personnel was over-the-top friendly and personable. If for no other reason, I would stay again because I felt so welcomed. The decor of the entire hotel reminded me of Las Vegas--for a moment, I fooled myself into believing I was actually in Las Vegas! I guess I've been travelling too much! Kroger's was having a Job Fair and evidently some kind of regional meeting while I was in the hotel. That made the parking lot very crowded and difficult to park at times. I hope some people got jobs. It looks like many are out of work in Memphis, as is the situation everywhere. I did have compli breakfast, which was good (not great), and had lunch in the bar area one day--a salad which I found to be exceptional. This was my first or 2nd visit to Memphis. I booked the hotel in hast, just before dashing off to the airport. I thought I was booking the downtown hotel. I think I would have enjoyed that more, but, this place was fine, and they looked like they needed the business, so I'm glad I stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms but not safe!”
Reviews.Author: li0nel61
Reviews.Content: Twelve (12) cars were broken into with lots of damage and items stolen the weekend of August 6 and 7. Other hotels close by in area were hit too but THIS hotel is gated and is supposed to have a guard on duty! This part of town off Perkins is unsafe now. Will never stay in this area again.

Reviews.Title: “Met Expectations”
Reviews.Author: EvetteD
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice. The grounds and rooms were clean. Parking was somewhat a challenge.

Reviews.Title: “Much Improved”
Reviews.Author: topresorts
Reviews.Content: This hotel really used to be a dump and management has made great strides. The facilities are old and desperately need remodeling but the staff makes due quite nicely. Rooms are a good size. Breakfast buffet was good. It was 103 degrees when we were there and the AC could not keep up. Fitness center was nice and overall, the hotel is a good value for the money. Main issue is the neighborhood which is in a ghetto. The iron gates outside the hotel are a clue. You definitely do not want to go our at night here.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible value”
Reviews.Author: ChitownCF
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed here. It is not in the heart of things, but roads make getting anywhere easy. The hotel is beautiful, spotlessly clean, and the help are very friendly and helpful. Food is wonderful and priced right.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Staff and Bed but Needs Remodeling”
Reviews.Author: ATLconsultant
Reviews.Content: The TVs are older non-flat screen variety. Carpet in lobby and in rooms smell musty and water damaged. Don't know what happened. My co-worker said his room smelled water damaged as well. The towels are nice and organized. The bed is ultra-soft and comfy. The room was cleaned immaculately each day. The room service is terribly expensive, especially for Memphis. One regular entree with ice water with no dessert or anything else was $42.00. The staff was very friendly and very efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Predictably good Marriott”
Reviews.Author: jpl88
Reviews.Content: This is a very standard Marriott that is getting a little dated. Predictably good comfort and amenities. Location wasn't so bad as traffic in Memphis area seems relatively light.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for Out of Way Location”
Reviews.Author: Charlie_Hotlanta
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located a few miles east of the airport, but no airport noice. It is not really near anything (pretty far from downtown Memphis or Germantown), so it's best to head there after dinner. I've stayed there several times and the staff are always pleasant and efficient. Rooms are nice (typical Marriott) with excellent beds. Decent workout facility, but running outside is probably not an options since the areas is a little suspect. Receive free buffet breakfast at check-in most recent visit, which was a nice touch. Parking on-site is free and ample.

Reviews.Title: “Biggest problem was leaving the ultra comfy bed to see Memphis!”
Reviews.Author: misscindyjo
Reviews.Content: Front desk folks were wonderful. Room(10th floor) was very clean and so comfy! My only complaint was the Breakfast Buffet. Really not managed well. . Food quality and service here not at all in line with the quality of an otherwise excellent stay .

Reviews.Title: “Average Marriott...needs remodeling”
Reviews.Author: Wayne0301
Reviews.Content: Older Marriott that is in need of remodeling. Everything was clean but the wear and tear were showing in some places. The rooms were small but comfortable. The TV's in the room are older with below average reception. Service and staff were friendly and professional.

Reviews.Title: “Missing items in hotel room turns ugly”
Reviews.Author: harmarsstar
Reviews.Content: The room was pretty, the location was alright, and parking was expensive, but easy. But when I left behind my wedding ring that morning, I was sure it would still be there. I was confident in calling them to go up to my room to grab it for me. They never called me back, I called later that afternoon, and they said they would get back to me, and never did. Lets just say I tried multiple times to contact someone and no one had the balls to tell me that my ring was gone. I understand I left my ring behind, Iâ€™ve taken fault for that. But to treat your customers with such disrespect and rudeness is such a terrible feeling. Can't someone from the hotel have the decency to speak to their hotel guest? The manager doesn't have the decency? Someone couldn't just call me back to say, "We're sorry, we looked everywhere. We would love to have you back and show you how much we appreciate your patience and understanding." This has been dragging on for 2 weeks now and still no one to actually speak to. The Marriot staff prolongs their problems until their guests hopefully forget about them. If someone from the hotel staff would have helped me the first time I called, this would be resolved by now.

Reviews.Title: “Great property and very friendly staff...”
Reviews.Author: honeymoonin
Reviews.Content: I just checked out from a two night stay and it was terriffic. Super comfy beds. Staff was always pleasent, smiling, and willing to help. I actually used the gym and it was well above average. Multiple machines including many with iPod plugs. Pretty cool but I'm easily amused. Price was a little high bit only $10 more than the courtyard down the road. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Feels like home”
Reviews.Author: suncoastrider
Reviews.Content: After experiencing rude customer service during earlier stays in Memphis at other hotels (including the downtown Marriott), I was a little leery about this visit. I stayed three nights and, without fail, treated professionally and always made to feel at home. It's rare to find staff so courteous across the board. So, hat's off to management. I particularly want to recognize DeLois. She is the epitome of customer service. The location is close to the airport but not in the best of areas. This made dining options either the hotel or a little bit of a drive in truly inclement weather. One other quibble: the televisions need updating. Come on, beautiful hotel, great staff and crappy tvs? All in all, great stay with a few quibbles.

Reviews.Title: “Whatever you like if you ask politely”
Reviews.Author: travelconeja
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an older hotel, granted, however when one is at a hotel sleep is a priority, but the room is not all you are there for. There is the bar, pool, koi pond, restaurant, even $30 unlimited porn packages! I love this place. This is my favorite hideaway hotel when I want to be away, but not too far. Its location and the gates make me feel safer. The office complex across the street has them too. The rooms are okay for the $129+ it'll cost you. The real features are the view from the top floor or from the roof. Can we say sunset cocktails on the roof? Also, there is a koi pond (read: super private aft 9pm xcept for the occasional bar smokers) off the lobby outside the bar. You may dine and take any meal out there from breakfast til 12am when room service closes. The bar here is excellent for lounging or relaxing and one will typically encounter other business people. The pool is awesome and also very private. This is a nice hotel for couples to be alone together. Also, if you are a rewards member, why are you not taking advantage of the concierge lounge on top floor? Flatscreen tvs, books, free food and premium liquor. FREE Breakfast, good food, upstairs! Also in the evening, the cocktail session in the lounge is awesome. Open til 10pm with premium drinks, hot appetizers, nuts, cheese, fruits, yogurts, waters, free soda. Hint:stuff you can take back to your room for free. You pay for it by repeatedly being their client. Also, ask for a VIP card so that you may go into the lounge even if you don't have a million points. If you ask that means you know and if you know they figure no harm giving it to you because obviously you've been before. If you get one keep it. As long as your not at one of the properties where the card gives you access to the entire floor you can still use it. Hop on the elevator, get off, pop it in the door and when it doesn't work watch whoever is working in there open if for you and say,"sorry about your card, please do come in". If you are looking for a brand new facility that screams million dollar renovation this is not it! If you are looking for a hotel with more than decent rooms where you can have some fun this is it. As for sleep quality, I'll be honest: past 6am hang it up. The thing i despise about business hotels is that every man with 3 inches of hair insists on shampooing and blowdrying for 20mins at 6:30. The whirring of blow dryers does not stop until about 9:30 or so when the business ppl are out of their rooms. That is my only complaint. I've been going here since 2005.

Reviews.Title: “Better Than Expected.....”
Reviews.Author: AZyoung
Reviews.Content: This place is really nice. The staff is very friendly and the grounds are stunning. The property entrance is filled with beautiful landscape, trees, and flowers. The lobby is also nice. The rooms are CLEAN, relaxing and inviting, with upgraded bed linens, fluffy pillows and towels, and comfortable beds. There are a few restaurants near the hotel. You definitely need a car as the location is not near any tourist sites, but freeways are pretty close and parking is free. Give this hotel a try you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: mjdallas
Reviews.Content: After reading prior reviews we were a little hesitant to stay here, however our whole visit was great. When we arrived we were greeted and made to feel welcome. We were upgraded (Platinum benefit) to the Concierge level and given breakfast coupons for each morning. The General Manager came over to us as we were checking in to welcome us. The rooms were clean, quiet and well appointed (new bedding but old style tv's). The breakfast buffet was typical Marriott with the addition of grits. There was someone making omlets and waffles to order. Contrary to previous reviews read here, the Orange Juice not powdered but is Tropicana (not from Concetrate)-we saw the carton. The first evening when we told the bellman that we were going to Corky's for barbecue he offered to drive us in the Marriott van. We thanked him but drove ourselves (the parking lot at the restaurant was so crowded that we should have let him drive us). One evening we came back from dinner and wanted to get dessert in the restaurant. The restaurant had already closed, but the restaurant manager told us "no problem"' and let us order dessert and coffee. There is a large parking lot and the Free parking was a plus. We would definitely stay here again. The entire staff was very helpful with restaurant and area information.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby hotel, bad food”
Reviews.Author: Duffety
Reviews.Content: We went to Memphis for my husband's college fraternity reunion and stayed at this Marriott for 3 nights. The formal dinner was held at there, too. One day they failed to make up the room. True, I had the "do not disturb" sign out until 9 a.m. but they never came back ! The smell of wet towels greeted us when we returned to the room in the afternoon and we had to turn the a/c down to 64 degrees or so to ease the stench after the sun had warmed everything and begun to mildew the room. I called the front desk and was informed that the help had already left for the day, so I made the beds myself and went in search of coffee and toiletries. The one day we partook of the breakfast buffet was memorable for the powdered orange "juice" and probably powdered eggs. Tasteless food except for excess salt. Sadly, the dinner at the function was equally limp and devoid of taste. If we return we will not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “WEIRD Location, decent hotel, understaffed”
Reviews.Author: Windsor999
Reviews.Content: Made it to Memphis for a conference and actually thought this Hotel was downtown -it was not. It was a 13 story property surrounded by a high spiked fence with motorized gates...? In walking distance was Taco Bell, multiple dollar stores, cell phone stores and many vacant businesses. It felt weird and the high fence made me wonder what exactly went on there? Overall nothing to really complain about. Check it took a while -there wasn't enough staff at the front desk. and this occured when ever I needed directions or a when my key card became demagnitized. The rooms were clean and although the hall was a little stinky the room was fine. I would say it seemed a little dog eared -wall paper stained and ripped, the rooms had small TV's and an oddly designed bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “There are no good full-service business hotels in Memphis”
Reviews.Author: NeenerNeener
Reviews.Content: There are no good full-service hotels in Memphis, and the Marriott East is no exception. I travel to Memphis frequently for work, so I've tried them all. For some reason, the full service hotels in Memphis are all older properties, badly in need of renovation. The Marriott East has scuffed-up walls, banged-up furniture, old fixtures and appliances, and cranky, noisy, leaky plumbing. This would be mitigated by a strong attempt to keep the place clean, but this is Memphis - poor customer service and slovenly housekeeping are the rule. I've become used to a routine of changing rooms upon arrival until finally being given one that is semi-tolerable. The Marriott rooms were shabby and not very clean, in addition to the afore-mentioned plumbing and appliance problems. When I checked in I was told that no rooms with King beds were available, despite my request (and Marriott Rewards status). I was given a room with two double beds. After all the room-changing, the least objectionable room was found. Only one of the beds had clean sheets - the other bed still had remnants of the last person who slept in it. There were spots of some kind of sticky goo embedded in the carpet throughout the room, and worst of all, while I was sitting at the desk reading email, a cockroach ran across my computer keyboard. Access to Internet services from the room cost $12.95. The hotel advertises both wired and wireless, but only the wireless worked. My computer reported a relatively low-strength signal in my room. I've given up trying to find a good business-class hotel in Memphis. Some of the less-costly discount chain places are actually better, although at this time of year they are often filled with tourists. Avoid this place.

Reviews.Title: “Managment DOES NOT CARE that a TREE FELL on OUR CAR.”
Reviews.Author: awhofan
Reviews.Content: Managment DOES NOT CARE that a TREE FELL on Our Car and another couples personal car. Was told if I want to contact Mgt fill out Marriotts paperwork. AT NO TIME DID A MGR CONTACT US and we are part of their Marriotts awards club staying a week. Everybody at the front desk wanted to find someting else to do, then help. At the front desk and each call, first words are "weather not responsable" or maybe they are rental cars. No it was my car,when I looked at the tree I noticed Beer bottles were smashed into them from the past and a dead bird in driveway for two days. MGT NOT WORKING in Memphis. June 12,2009

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: rainbowbrite3333
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there on our wedding night. We checked in with no problem and we were in a very nice suite. The bed was very comfy and it had a nice couch in the room. The bathroom was awesome. It had bath and body works shampoo/conditioners, which i'd never seen in a hotel. My husband had called ahead and had them bring fruit and sparkling cider, b/c we aren't drinkers. But they brought us champange anyway. The next morning we had breakfast included in our room rate so we got to enjoy the best breakfast before we left for florida. I'd stay there again. We loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Outside of town buyt convenient!”
Reviews.Author: VolvoGuy
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here for a Navy reunion.Nice quiet safe location ,Clean and large rooms,friendly staff and reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “avoid restaurant”
Reviews.Author: minnimay
Reviews.Content: The room was very nice, but to use free wi-fi that even camp grounds furnish, you must sit in hotel lobby. Not very convenient. The service at the restaurant was terrible ....tried breakfast, lunch and dinner....all on different days. Never any improvement. Not busy, just ridiculously slow. Have stayed in many hotels all over the country and this was the very worse for restaurant service anywhere I've stayed. Even complaining to the manager did not help .. Will never stay at this one again.

Reviews.Title: “Mold in air con made this unsatisfactory”
Reviews.Author: LondonLib
Reviews.Content: The hotel common areas were pleasant, and the room was standard issue Marriott and quite clean with the exception of a definite mold/mildew issue in the HVAC. In the first room I was assigned on the 12th floor (Concierge Level), the odor was overwhelming. The second room, also on the 12th floor was marginally better, but still resulted in a sore throat in the morning. I requested the following morning to move to a different room because of this specific problem, and the front desk person was very indifferent and told me I would have to telephone early in the afternoon to see if would be possible to be reassigned to a different room. When told that I would be unable to call at that time due to a business meeting, she told me it was likely that all rooms would be full by the time I returned in the early evening. There was no offer to check the HVAC, and when I asked if this could be done, she said "I'll make a note of it," without any assurances. Mold in air conditioning units is a health and safety issue. This Marriott must be considered remiss in this regard, and I can not recommend it for this reason. There were some very helpful and pleasant staff, especially the airport shuttle drivers. Poor engineering and the lack of interest (and resolution) with the mold/mildew issue are unacceptable for a Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Kubzfan
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 1 night on business. Don't typically stay at Marriott's for the reasons that are about to follow: Having stayed in approx 100 hotels per year on business, I look for nice hotels with value added ammenities. Why is it the more you pay, the less value you receive? Case in point, $150 for an older, yet nice hotel. Overpriced breakfast without a free continental breakfast at minimum. Charge for internet with 95% of other hotels offering for free. Limited TV channels, Overpriced bar... etc... This is a strange location for a Marriott. Area on the run-down side.... No higher end restaurants nearby - not even the standard Applebee's / Chile's. On the positive side: Nice grounds, free parking (unusual for Marriotts), Lavish lobby. Wonderful staff, comfortable beds, clean rooms etc... Most likely won't stay upon return. Definately wouldn't consider on leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: DenverTravelGirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one night while on a business trip in Memphis. The hotel is very close to the airport and it offered a shuttle service every half hour. The airport shuttle was on time and effective. The rooms were nice with a comfortable bed, newer dÃ©cor (an older TV) and a large and clean bathroom offering Bed, Bath, and Beyond products. From room service, you can order pizza (Unoâ€™s), regular American fare (from their main restaurant), and breakfast beginning at 6:00 am. The main lobby does not have a coffee shop but they do have a coffee station with â€œcoffee to goâ€� available. Overall, a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: MikeOxford_CT
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a 2-night stay at the Memphis Marriott in mid-November and found very little wrong with this hotel property. At great feature with this hotel is the parking lot is gated whereas the surrounding hotels have open parking lots. Seeing as the neighborhoods aren't the greatest, you can be sure your car and (valued) Elvis memorabilia are safe. The lobby and hotel room were immaculate. Since we went during an off peak time, we had the pool and jacuzzi all to ourselves and there facilities were spotless with plenty of towels. The hotel even had bellmen who greeted veryone at the door to the lobby and never hestitated to help with your bags. I definately recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the Memphis area and the price was right ($91/night).

Reviews.Title: “Nice Older Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DallasJackson57
Reviews.Content: All I really need is a comfortable bed and a hot shower and this Marriott had a very comfortable bed and a nice shower. On the downside, it had a small bathroom countertop, no fridge or microwave, the room smelled like mold, and the toilet didn't flush. A maintenance person did respond within 15 minutes and fixed the toilet.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed this Marriott”
Reviews.Author: globetrotter2
Reviews.Content: My friend & I stayed one night here & truly enjoyed this Marriott. Beds were really comfortable (including the comfy pillows). The buffet breakfast was very nice. Location worked well for us - as we were there to visit Graceland & another friend of mine in Collierville. The staff was very helpful, friendly & willing to please. We stayed one night also at the Hyatt Place (it was fine). Would definitely stay at this Marriott should I return to Memphis in the future. I travel alot & stay in many hotels in many locations and would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great! Great! Great!”
Reviews.Author: darknluvlie
Reviews.Content: My family and I were at attending a family reunion in Memphis and the hotel where the reunion was to take place was booked up; so we had to make other lodging arrangements. We needed a hotel near the reuinon site so that we would not be traveling far distances throughout the day and that is when we found the Marriott East. Once we researched the hotel we were ready to book a room for the weekend and upon arrival we were extremly pleased with the services of the hotel. The room was extremly clean and the bed was extra comfortable after a day of family outings. My one year old is my best critic when it comes to our daily activities and the entire time we were there no complaints whatsoever. She really enjoyed her play time in both of the swimming pools as well as her gourmet kids macoroni and cheese she ordered from room service for dinner. In the end, this was one of our best stays in a hotel in a very long while. We reccomend this hotel to anyone staying in the Memphis area because of their great service and location to many area attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and what? no freebies?”
Reviews.Author: CajunMomma
Reviews.Content: I have never stayed in a Marriott before because rooms there are usually more expensive than Holiday Inns, Comfort Inns, etc. After staying at the Marriott Memphis East for four days, I'll never stay in a Marriott again. Sure, the place was nice and the beds were very comfortable, but they did not offer free breakfast. You could have a continental breakfast delivered to your room for $9! The drinks in the bar were ridiculously overpriced - $10 for the advertised special. No wireless Internet in the rooms, only in the business center. No free Internet -- for about $7.00 a day, you could hook up to the Internet in the room (not wireless). I can't believe that any hotel charges for Internet in this day and age. I was also told that they charged about $12 per day to park your car in the parking lot. Again, this is unheard of. The hotel has a shuttle, but it will only take guests to and from the airport and within a five mile vicinity. Downtown Memphis/Beale Street is not in range. They charged us $30 each way to go to Beale Street. We had also requested two double beds and were given a king. We were told that we could not change rooms. This hotel is only for business customers with fat expensive accounts.

Reviews.Title: “Not what you expect”
Reviews.Author: AuburnIE
Reviews.Content: We booked our trip through an online website for a 2 double bed room as we have 2 children ages 10 and 13. At the outset of our check-in we began having issues. When we arrived at the Marriott with rooms that were prepaid (as required on the booking website), we were informed that our room was a king-sized bed and a twin bed (pull out sofa). The front desk hospitality was lacking and they were unwilling to make any changes to our room. Apparently, they are not committed to give you the room that you request on the website. Inside the room, the kingsized bed was only a little bigger than a normal queensized bed, and the twinsized sofa sleeper was only big enough for one of our children. Therefore, my 10 year old son slept in the bed with my husband and me. In addition, the faucet in the bathroom leaked continuously. This was irrating at 2 in the morning after my son had kicked me in the back while we were sleeping. Another issue we had was with the swimming pool. The indoor swimming pool was over-chlorinated and the fumes caused burning eyes and breathing problems in the pool area. The only good experience we had was with the service staff. The maids did an excellent job keeping the rooms clean and the bellhops were extremely friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Memphis Marriott East”
Reviews.Author: FreeSandySprings
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Memphis Marriott East for SRLC 2006. It was very convenient to downtown Memphis (about 15-20 minutes away) & only costed $109 per night over the weekend. So, it was quite affordable, compared to the downtown hotels, which were pricing out at $179+ per night that same weekend. The hotel is very clean, and the staff is friendly & helpful.

HotelInfo.Name: Memphis Marriott East
HotelInfo.Address: 2625 Thousand Oaks Boulevard, Memphis, TN 38118
